formalMetadata.description: A page with an English sentence that contains a German acronym. The German expansion of the acronym is provided in the title attribute of the acronym element, which also has a lang attribute with the value "fr" for French instead of "de" for German.
formalMetadata.title: Incorrect language identification for German acronym in English text
formalMetadata.dc:creator: Christophe.Strobbe@esat.kuleuven.be

testElement.specReference: Specifying the language of content: the lang attribute

purpose.p: This test case is intended to fail because the language of the (German) expansion of the acronym is not correctly identified.

expertGuidance.p: Check whether the change in human language for the title attribute of the acronym element is correctly identified.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser cannot determine the human language of the acronym in the document.

techComment.p: The acronym should have a lang attribute with value "de" instead of "fr".
This test case does not map to a WCAG 2.0 technique or failure.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser cannot determine the natural language of the acronym in the document.

techComment.p: The acronym should have a lang attribute with value "de" instead of "fr".
This test case maps to technique H58: Using the lang attribute to identify changes in the natural language (http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/WD-WCAG20-TECHS-20060427/Overview.html#H58) but fails.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser cannot determine the natural language of the acronym in the document.

techComment.p: The acronym should have a lang attribute with value "de" instead of "fr".
